values.description:
Currently multiplying `Pose3` objects does not match the behavior of multiplying `Matrix4` coordinate transformation matrices. This is illustrated in 7f7ed51, where `matrix1 * matrix2 * matrix3 == pose3 * pose2 * pose1`. This has been discussed in #60 and previously in [gazebo issue 216](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/issues/216/pose-addition-and-subtraction-needs-work). The `*` operator is not used often, so we should just change it to be correct.

I noticed this issue most recently while working on an sdformat pull request related to pose transformations.

* https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/468/pose-dom/commits

~~I've targeted `ign-math4`, but we should discuss where this change should be made and released.~~

EDIT: I've re-targeted to `ign-math5`
values.title: Change definition of Pose3 `*` operator to fix multiplication order (#60)

summary.raw:
Currently multiplying `Pose3` objects does not match the behavior of multiplying `Matrix4` coordinate transformation matrices. This is illustrated in 7f7ed51, where `matrix1 * matrix2 * matrix3 == pose3 * pose2 * pose1`. This has been discussed in #60 and previously in [gazebo issue 216](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/issues/216/pose-addition-and-subtraction-needs-work). The `*` operator is not used often, so we should just change it to be correct.

I noticed this issue most recently while working on an sdformat pull request related to pose transformations.

* https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/468/pose-dom/commits

~~I've targeted `ign-math4`, but we should discuss where this change should be made and released.~~

EDIT: I've re-targeted to `ign-math5`
summary.html:
Currently multiplying Pose3 objects does not match the behavior of multiplying Matrix4 coordinate transformation matrices. This is illustrated in 7f7ed51, where matrix1 * matrix2 * matrix3 == pose3 * pose2 * pose1. This has been discussed in #60 and previously in gazebo issue 216. The * operator is not used often, so we should just change it to be correct.

I noticed this issue most recently while working on an sdformat pull request related to pose transformations.

  • https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/468/pose-dom/commits

I've targeted ign-math4, but we should discuss where this change should be made and released.

EDIT: I've re-targeted to ign-math5

values.description: Eigen has a templated [AlignedBox class](https://eigen.tuxfamily.org/dox-devel/classEigen_1_1AlignedBox.html), and its `AlignedBox3d` specialization maps pretty closely to our [AxisAlignedBox](https://ignitionrobotics.org/api/math/6.0/classignition_1_1math_1_1AxisAlignedBox.html) class. This pull request adds `convert` functions for these two types.
values.title: eigen3: add conversion functions for Eigen::AlignedBox3d <=> ignition::math::AxisAlignedBox

summary.raw: Eigen has a templated [AlignedBox class](https://eigen.tuxfamily.org/dox-devel/classEigen_1_1AlignedBox.html), and its `AlignedBox3d` specialization maps pretty closely to our [AxisAlignedBox](https://ignitionrobotics.org/api/math/6.0/classignition_1_1math_1_1AxisAlignedBox.html) class. This pull request adds `convert` functions for these two types.
summary.html: Eigen has a templated AlignedBox class, and its AlignedBox3d specialization maps pretty closely to our AxisAlignedBox class. This pull request adds convert functions for these two types.

This PR is blocking the wheel odometry functionality for subt. Fast reviews are highly encouraged.

values.description:
DiffDriveOdometry_TEST is failing on macOS:

[![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_math-ci-ign-math6-homebrew-amd64&build=9)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_math-ci-ign-math6-homebrew-amd64/9/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_math-ci-ign-math6-homebrew-amd64/9/testReport

By replacing the thread sleep_for calls with exact times, the test is fixed.
values.title: DiffDriveOdometry_TEST: use exact times instead of thread sleep_for to fix test on macOS

By replacing the thread sleep_for calls with exact times, the test is fixed.

values.description: In a directed graph, a source is a vertex with only outgoing edges, while a sink has only incoming edges. If a directed graph can be represented as a directed tree, then the graph has a single source vertex that corresponds to the root of the tree. This should help with #82.
values.title: GraphAlgorithms: add functions for finding source and sink vertices in a DirectedGraph

summary.raw: In a directed graph, a source is a vertex with only outgoing edges, while a sink has only incoming edges. If a directed graph can be represented as a directed tree, then the graph has a single source vertex that corresponds to the root of the tree. This should help with #82.
summary.html: In a directed graph, a source is a vertex with only outgoing edges, while a sink has only incoming edges. If a directed graph can be represented as a directed tree, then the graph has a single source vertex that corresponds to the root of the tree. This should help with #82.

values.description:
An `INTEGRATION_ExamplesBuild_TEST` was added in pull request #325, though it requires `make install` to be run before `make test`. This currently causing the nightly debbuild jobs to fail, since they run `make test` before `make install`:

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ign-math6-debbuilder&build=237)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign-math6-debbuilder/237/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign-math6-debbuilder/237/

Rather than disable testing during deb-builds, which is useful for catching bugs in different architectures, I've used `ExternalProject_Add` to do a fake install to a folder inside the build directory. This `FAKE_INSTALL` target is also used in ign-cmake:

* #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-cmake/src/799f9d9140c69e8faf694022e992c02c8bf42b9c/CMakeLists.txt#lines-155:175

One change I've made compared to `ign-cmake` is setting the `LOG_*` variables to true which prevents console output for the `FAKE_INSTALL` target, since it can be a bit noisy.
values.title: Create FAKE_INSTALL target so example compilation can be tested without doing a real install

summary.raw:
An `INTEGRATION_ExamplesBuild_TEST` was added in pull request #325, though it requires `make install` to be run before `make test`. This currently causing the nightly debbuild jobs to fail, since they run `make test` before `make install`:

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ign-math6-debbuilder&build=237)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign-math6-debbuilder/237/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign-math6-debbuilder/237/

Rather than disable testing during deb-builds, which is useful for catching bugs in different architectures, I've used `ExternalProject_Add` to do a fake install to a folder inside the build directory. This `FAKE_INSTALL` target is also used in ign-cmake:

* #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-cmake/src/799f9d9140c69e8faf694022e992c02c8bf42b9c/CMakeLists.txt#lines-155:175

One change I've made compared to `ign-cmake` is setting the `LOG_*` variables to true which prevents console output for the `FAKE_INSTALL` target, since it can be a bit noisy.
summary.html:
An INTEGRATION_ExamplesBuild_TEST was added in pull request #325, though it requires make install to be run before make test. This currently causing the nightly debbuild jobs to fail, since they run make test before make install:

  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign-math6-debbuilder/237/

Rather than disable testing during deb-builds, which is useful for catching bugs in different architectures, I've used ExternalProject_Add to do a fake install to a folder inside the build directory. This FAKE_INSTALL target is also used in ign-cmake:

  • #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-cmake/src/799f9d9140c69e8faf694022e992c02c8bf42b9c/CMakeLists.txt#lines-155:175

One change I've made compared to ign-cmake is setting the LOG_* variables to true which prevents console output for the FAKE_INSTALL target, since it can be a bit noisy.

values.description:
GCC9 adds a few new warnings to `-Wextra` per the [Release notes](https://gcc.gnu.org/gcc-9/changes.html).

We were impacted by:

* [-Wdeprecated-copy](https://gcc.gnu.org/onlinedocs/gcc-9.1.0/gcc/C_002b_002b-Dialect-Options.html#index-Wdeprecated-copy)
* [-Wpessimizing-move](https://gcc.gnu.org/onlinedocs/gcc-9.1.0/gcc/C_002b_002b-Dialect-Options.html#index-Wpessimizing-move)

‌
values.title: Clean up a few new GCC9 warnings

GCC9 adds a few new warnings to `-Wextra` per the [Release notes](https://gcc.gnu.org/gcc-9/changes.html).

We were impacted by:

* [-Wdeprecated-copy](https://gcc.gnu.org/onlinedocs/gcc-9.1.0/gcc/C_002b_002b-Dialect-Options.html#index-Wdeprecated-copy)
* [-Wpessimizing-move](https://gcc.gnu.org/onlinedocs/gcc-9.1.0/gcc/C_002b_002b-Dialect-Options.html#index-Wpessimizing-move)

‌

values.description:
This is a general purpose class that follows [this formula](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ornstein%E2%80%93Uhlenbeck_process).

I chose to call it a GaussMarkov process insteas of an OrnsteinUhlenbeck because of name recognition and ease of typing.

I plan to use this for modeling sea currents.
values.title: Added GaussMarkovProcess

values.description: This PR sets the random seed before sampling when there’s non-zero noise. The resulting test just checks repeatability given a seed, as opposed to testing that the randomness is correct. But it’s an improvement over the earlier version, which wouldn’t pass reliably.
values.title: Set seed to make gmp tests repeatable

summary.raw: This PR sets the random seed before sampling when there’s non-zero noise. The resulting test just checks repeatability given a seed, as opposed to testing that the randomness is correct. But it’s an improvement over the earlier version, which wouldn’t pass reliably.
summary.html: This PR sets the random seed before sampling when there’s non-zero noise. The resulting test just checks repeatability given a seed, as opposed to testing that the randomness is correct. But it’s an improvement over the earlier version, which wouldn’t pass reliably.

values.description: @{557058:90bc87b0-2886-4377-a17c-3a6629a697ff} initially noticed a problem with the off-diagonal moment of inertia terms when adding Inertials with pose offsets. The bug was subtracting the off-diagonal terms from the wrong variable. I've added a test to illustrate the problem, that is hopefully easy enough to follow.
values.title: Fix bug in Inertial addition of off-diagonal moment of inertia terms with pose offsets

summary.raw: @{557058:90bc87b0-2886-4377-a17c-3a6629a697ff} initially noticed a problem with the off-diagonal moment of inertia terms when adding Inertials with pose offsets. The bug was subtracting the off-diagonal terms from the wrong variable. I've added a test to illustrate the problem, that is hopefully easy enough to follow.
summary.html: @Addisu Z. Taddese initially noticed a problem with the off-diagonal moment of inertia terms when adding Inertials with pose offsets. The bug was subtracting the off-diagonal terms from the wrong variable. I've added a test to illustrate the problem, that is hopefully easy enough to follow.
